messages.message: Trying out multifile at the moment to create a video for release :slightly_smiling_face: I have uploaded 6 annual reports - they are all fairly lengthy (150-200 pages). My prompt is to create a table of revenue across these reports between 2018 and 2023. But it just craps out on me without telling me why. This is Prod. Is there something unstable with Prod at the moment, or can it simply not handle the length of these docs (in this case we need a clearer error message). See screenshot. Docs are here (https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1XPd8Tt1XBHVA0mC_pEdaMz3ZPWXObJ7S?usp=sharing) in case useful.
Limiting scope to 3 files gave me a response, but seem to consider only 1 doc, and not look across docs despite having them in scope
It seems really easy (and confusing) that I can add the same file multiple times to the scope (this is Prod)
@Hari @Rakesh — this seems like a response streaming error. Please take a look. <!subteam^S05BKH20B4K>
Adding another screenshot of keeping the same docs many times over in scope
We’ll figure this out, and I’ll record the marketing release video. Thanks for sharing the feedback @Bas

Thanks @Varun Jain and apologies. Want this to work :disappointed: Maybe we can cheat and use a different environment for the recording and cut the address bar off the recording - let me check if I have the same problem in sandbox :)
The multi doc repeated scope bug is fixed in UAT, and will be applied to prod in the 23.49 release

I tried this on aihub-uat and the query worked on 6 documents as well. Attached screenshot.
I found a gateway timeout in underlying call on aihub prod. 

There were lot of memory and latency optimizations in 23.49 for multi doc which are not present in aihub prod yet which should go in on Monday.

I confirm it worked fine in sandbox also. It took me a while to trick it in creating a pretty table rather than a bullet list. That might actually be more of a feature request actually - especially in Multistep and longer prompts it is quite unpredictable whether the prompt will return a table, bullet list, a paragraph, full json etc. It could be interesting to combine some features of Build (eg Clean) into Converse. Instead of just the download button, it could say reformat or refine, and allow you to prompt the response again to put something in a pretty table or bulletize a paragraph
